article.title: Joint Strong and Weak Lensing Analysis of the Massive Cluster Field J0850+3604

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the black polygon in the left panel of Figure 1 represent?
choices: The region of color-color space corresponding to foreground galaxies.
The region of color-color space corresponding to background galaxies.
The region of color-color space corresponding to cluster member galaxies.
The region of color-color space corresponding to galaxies with high photometric redshift errors.

multiple_choice_question.text: What causes the decrease in the number density of background galaxies within the central ~2\' in the right panel of Figure 2?
choices: Masking of background sources by cluster members.
Depletion of the galaxy number counts due to lensing magnification.
Photometric redshift errors causing misclassification of background galaxies.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is unique about the northern arc in Figure 6 compared to the southern arc?
choices: The northern arc is at a higher redshift than the southern arc.
The northern arc is formed by a merging pair of images from the outskirts of the source galaxy.
The northern arc is not magnified by the cluster lens.
The northern arc is a single, unlensed image of the source galaxy.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the quantity <Bwl> represent in Formula (3)?
choices: The mean distance ratio of the background source population.
The angular diameter distance to the lens.
The projected surface mass density of the lens.
